comment.returns: promise to provide the stdout and stderr streams form the child process.

tags.text:
executes `command` in a child process and promises to return the stdout and stderr streams. 
let utils = require('./cpUtils');
utils.exec(cmd)
.then((stdout, stderr) => {...})
.catch(err => {...});

comment.text: the options to pass along to the shell

comment.shortText:
# Excel
Convenience functions to access tables in Excel files.
Uses the {@link https://github.com/SheetJS/js-xlsx Sheet JS xlsx parser and writer}.
A structure describing an Excel table

comment.shortText:
Logging convenience functions. ## Usage 
import log from './log';
log.info('by the way:'); // -> 20160817 09:59:08.032 info by the way:
log.error('oh dear!');   // -> 20160817 09:59:08.045 error *** oh dear!
Type definition for level descriptors
Debug reporting level with importance 0
Warning reporting level with importance 3
Info reporting level with importance 1
Info reporting level with importance 2
current date format string. See [date module]('_date_.html')
current reporting level, same across all modules
name of the current log file, or undefined
map of valid reporting levels

tags.text:
Utility Modules for use with Node.js
======================================
Provides
- {@link hsNode.log log}: logging support
- {@link hsNode.date date}: sprintf-style date formatting
- {@link hsNode.excel excel}: reading tables from Excel files
- {@link hsNode.hsLibs hsLibs}: NodeJS module wrapper for hs and hsData libraries
